title: Azure Developer Associate
subtitle: Develop Cloud Solutions with Azure
description: Develop cloud solutions with Azure services and tools
overview: Comprehensive developer training focusing on building cloud applications and services on Microsoft Azure. Learn to design, build, test, and maintain cloud applications and services, utilizing Azure services for compute, storage, databases, and security.

learningObjectives.title: Develop Azure Compute Solutions
learningObjectives.description: Develop Azure compute solutions using Azure Functions, Logic Apps, App Service, containers, and Kubernetes

learningObjectives.title: Develop for Azure Storage
learningObjectives.description: Develop solutions that use Cosmos DB, relational databases, blob storage, Redis Cache, and Azure Search

learningObjectives.title: Implement Azure Security
learningObjectives.description: Implement authentication, authorization, Key Vault, managed identities, and secure configuration

learningObjectives.title: Monitor and Optimize Solutions
learningObjectives.description: Monitor applications with Application Insights, optimize performance, and implement caching strategies

learningObjectives.title: Connect to Azure Services
learningObjectives.description: Connect to and consume Azure services, implement API Management, and integrate third-party services

prerequisites: Proficiency in Azure-supported programming language (C#, Python, JavaScript, Java)
Experience with Azure services and tools
Basic knowledge of REST APIs and HTTP

instructor.name: Yaïr Knijn
instructor.title: Principal Cloud Architect & Engineer
instructor.bio: Microsoft Certified Azure Solutions Architect Expert with 8+ years of experience in cloud development and architecture. Specializes in building scalable cloud applications and implementing DevOps practices.

personalStory.story: As a developer who has built dozens of cloud-native applications on Azure, I've made every mistake in the book—and learned from them. From serverless architectures to containerized workloads, I'll show you the development patterns that lead to maintainable, scalable applications. This isn't theory; it's what works in production.
